text: Prunus hainanensis is a species of cherry endemic to Hainan province, China. It is very similar to Prunus campanulata and grows only at 900-1200m in the Hainan Bawangling National Nature Reserve. It has pink flowers and, accordingly, some potential as an ornamental.http://www.efloras.org/florataxon.aspx?flora_id=2&taxon;_id=250084319 ==References== hainanensis Category:Cherry blossom Category:Flora of Hainan Category:Trees of China
title: Prunus hainanensis
